channel.title: Tutorial section
channel.description: Implement the old system again please. It's getting filled with really pointless and not-so-good tutorials..

item.description:

I believe the mod used is not compatible with SMF 2.0, though that could be completely wrong. I do agree that it should be back.

I didn’t know they used a whole Mod for the old Tut section. I thought they just added Moderation to the section, to make it so the posts had to be approved. I’ve built SMF countless times. HTML & PHP > Java when it comes to difficulty.
[/quote]

You have no idea whatsoever of what you are talking about.[/quote]

But I do. Wanna know how many SMF Forums I’ve set up?

item.title: Tutorial section
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Wait, lets think about this.

The old system never had REAL tutorials there. It was just simple bug fixes or tutorials 80% of the people did not understand.

Its funny how I thought people would start posting legit tutorials, but its now just like, how to add a new object at home, ect.

But there should be limits of what can be accepted and what not.

Such as my “tutorial” on how to add full delta woodcutting, but it wasn’t accepted before, even though its a legit tutorial.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:20, topic:357297”]ps, whoever thinks the mod isn’t compatible is cluless and ignorant.
You can easily set all the posts in the section to be moderated (just like the sponsered server applications board) so that all new topics made in the section have to be approved by a moderator.

I still have no clue why it hasn’t been implemented. I’ll notify mitb about it.[/quote]
